function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Tension between rigor and speed may lead to the dissemination of unverified or non-scientific evidence.","Impact":"Inaccurate information may inform policy and practice, leading to ineffective responses to public health crises.","Mitigation":"Implement a rigorous review process to filter out unsubstantiated sources and ensure evidence is scientifically supervised.","Technologies":"Knowledge translation platforms with advanced filtering algorithms.","People":"Policy and decision-makers, practitioners.","Owner":"Knowledge translation platforms, scientific communities."},{"Description":"Relevant evidence may exist but decision-makers may be unaware or unable to interpret or apply it to their own context.","Impact":"Ineffective use of existing evidence, leading to suboptimal decision-making in public health crises.","Mitigation":"Develop targeted communication strategies to ensure decision-makers are aware of and understand relevant evidence.","Technologies":"Knowledge dissemination platforms, data visualization tools.","People":"Policy and decision-makers, researchers.","Owner":"Research institutions, knowledge translation platforms."},{"Description":"Decision-makers are influenced by numerous forces, including institutional constraints, political context, interest group pressures, and personal convictions.","Impact":"Potential bias in decision-making processes and policies related to public health crises.","Mitigation":"Provide transparent guidance on how evidence should be interpreted and applied, considering external influencing factors.","Technologies":"Decision support systems, ethical decision-making frameworks.","People":"Policy and decision-makers, public health experts.","Owner":"Ethical advisory boards, public health organizations."}]}
